name: Hawaii Senbukan Karate Dojo
address: Classes are conducted in Jikoen's Social Hall, 1731 Kalihi Street, Honolulu, HI 96819
description: Founded in 1963 by Tomu Arakawa, this dojo conducts classes on Mondays and Thursdays. It is affiliated with Jikoen Buddhist Temple
services: Buddhist-owned Karate classes in Hawaii consultation

name: Daihonzan Chozen-Ji International Zen Dojo
description: This is a Rinzai Zen Buddhist temple and martial arts dojo that integrates Zen training with martial arts. It was founded by Omori Sogen and Tenshin Tanouye
services: Buddhist-owned Karate classes in Hawaii consultation

name: Universal Kempo Karate Schools
address: Multiple locations across Oahu and Maui. A primary contact number is (808) 487-2686
description: This school has been teaching martial arts in Hawaii for over 50 years, emphasizing traditional values. While not explicitly Buddhist-owned, it focuses on discipline and self-improvement, which align with Buddhist principles
services: Buddhist-owned Karate classes in Hawaii consultation

name: IKF Hawaii (International Karate Federation)
phone: (808) 221-4928 (for Kaimuki, Mid Pacific Institute, Kaneohe, Saint Louis School), (808) 349-6223 (for Palolo Hongwanji Mission, Punahou School)
description: Family-owned since 1966, IKF Hawaii offers karate programs for all ages, focusing on character development, self-discipline, respect, and humility, values often associated with Buddhist teachings
services: Buddhist-owned Karate classes in Hawaii consultation

name: Japan Karate Association (JKA) Hawaii
description: JKA Hawaii teaches Shotokan Karate and emphasizes technical excellence, self-discipline, respect, and courtesy, aligning with principles found in Buddhist philosophy. They are the Hawaii branch of the Japan Karate Association
services: Buddhist-owned Karate classes in Hawaii consultation
